The cool thing about nature is that
almost everywhere is a home to someone!

Today let's think about stone walls.
They are filled with nooks and crannies,
and guess what?
Somebody lives there!

Click to discover some wall dwelling animals.

Are you sure you
want to quit?

The ant can carry
20 times its body weight!

A chipmunk gathers
food in cheek
pouches that can
enlarge 3 times
bigger than
their heads!

The millipede was the earliest animal to breathe air
and come out of the water to live on land.

A group of toads
is called a knot.
Like frogs, they
start as tadpoles.

There are about
3000 kinds of snakes!
Their skin is smooth and dry.

A mouse has a HUGE appetite and
eats 15 to 20 times a day!

It's time for the Flip Awards!

You just unlocked a game!
